com.here.android.mpa.venues3d

Class VenueMapView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.here.android.mpa.mapping.MapView
          • com.here.android.mpa.venues3d.VenueMapView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent, VenueLayerAdapter, com.nokia.maps.MapUi

    public class VenueMapView
extends MapView
implements VenueLayerAdapter
    This class adds support for 3D venues to a map view. It allows Venues such as shopping malls and airports to be shown on the map as interactive 3D models. In addition, it enables the display of spaces inside venues and of venue access information (such as information about entrances).

    An instance of VenueMapView must be initialized with valid Activity instance by calling its VenueMapView.initialize(Activity) method. After that, you can customize the settings of VenueService and start the VenueService by calling VenueMapView.startVenueServiceAsync(VenueService.VenueServiceListener). To enable interactive use an instance of VenueMapLayer, add listeners for relevant events to the it as shown in the example below. 

     VenueMapView m_mapView;
 Map          m_map;

 public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
     // ...other initializations...
     m_mapView = (VenueMapView) findViewById(R.id.mapcanvas);
     MapEngine.getInstance().init(this, m_listener);
     // ... other initializations...
 }

 private OnEngineInitListener m_listener = new OnEngineInitListener() {
     // ...other initializations...
     m_map = new Map();
     m_mapView.setMap(m_map);
     m_mapView.initialize(m_activity);
     // ...customize VenueService settings...
     m_mapView.startVenueServiceAsync(m_venueServiceListener);
     // ...other initializations...
 }

 private VenueServiceListener m_venueServiceListener = new VenueServiceListener() {
    Override:
    public void onGetVenueCompleted(Venue arg0) { // 3d venue available }, public void onInitializationCompleted(InitStatus status) { if (result == InitStatus.ONLINE_SUCCESS || result == InitStatus.OFFLINE_SUCCESS) { mapFragment.addListener(m_venueServiceListener); } } }); // Venue can then be opened on a tap event: public void onVenueTapped(Venue venue, float x, float y) { mapFragment.openVenue(venue); }

    See MapView API documentation for more information about the map view in layout file and life cycle of it.

    A VenueMapView is an add-on to the base map functionality with its own content loading and cache. For this reason, if a venue is not already present in the cache, it needs to be downloaded before it can be displayed and therefore a small delay may occur before the venue appears on the the map.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(android.app.Activity activity)
        Initializes the VenueMapView object without starting VenueService.

        Note that even after initialization, most VenueMapView features cannot be used until VenueService is started.

        In order to init and start VenueService, you have to call VenueMapView.startVenueServiceAsync(VenueService.VenueServiceListener).

        Parameters:
        activity - The host activity.

      • startVenueServiceAsync

        public void startVenueServiceAsync(VenueService.VenueServiceListener serviceListener)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Asynchronously initialize and starts the VenueService object. Should be called only after VenueMapView is initialized (see VenueMapView.initialize(Activity).

        Note that the VenueService will not be initialized in-place - you have to wait till it will be ready by listening to VenueService.VenueServiceListener.onInitializationCompleted(VenueService.InitStatus) of provided VenueServiceListener object. After that, all the VenueMapView's functionality is ready for use.

        Parameters:
        serviceListener - Listener for the ready status.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the VenueMapView wasn't initialized.

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Description copied from class: MapView
        Propagates an activity's onResume() event to the view. Applications can call this method within the onResume() method of any activity which has a MapView as part of its view hierarchy. Note that unlike AndroidXMapFragment, MapView does not automatically handle the pausing and/or resuming of MapEngine. Owner of MapView is responsible to address the handling of MapEngine.onResume() if needed.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class MapView
        See Also:

      • isOpenModeEnabled

        public boolean isOpenModeEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: VenueLayerAdapter
        This method retrieves a Boolean indicating if the open mode is enabled. By default the open mode is disabled. In the open mode a user can see outer areas and spaces all the time. A selected floor and a floor stack is always shown. Venues are selected automatically.
        Specified by:
        isOpenModeEnabled in interface VenueLayerAdapter
        Returns:
        The Boolean value which indicates if the open mode is enabled.
        See Also:
        VenueLayerAdapter.setOpenModeEnabled(boolean)

      • setOpenModeEnabled

        public void setOpenModeEnabled(boolean value)
        Description copied from interface: VenueLayerAdapter
        This method sets a flag indicating whether or not the open mode is enabled. By default the open mode is disabled. In the open mode a user can see outer areas and spaces all the time. A selected floor and a floor stack is always shown. Venues are selected automatically.

        Updating the open mode is done in the background, so changes to this property may not be immediately reflected in its value. Changes to this property will deselect a selected venue.

        Specified by:
        setOpenModeEnabled in interface VenueLayerAdapter
        Parameters:
        value - Boolean value which indicates if the open mode is enabled.
        See Also:
        VenueLayerAdapter.isOpenModeEnabled()

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        venue - An instance of Venue for which to retrieve a venue controller object.
        Returns:
        An object representing the venue controller for the venue specified by the caller or null if the venue is not assigned to a controller (there is no such venue on the map).

      • selectVenue

        public boolean selectVenue(Venue venue)
        Description copied from interface: VenueLayerAdapter
        This method selects the Venue in a 3D view mode. In the 3D view mode, layers and spaces of the venue are visible to the application user. This method opens an already donwloaded venue. VenueMapFragment.VenueListener.onVenueSelected(Venue) callback method is called when the venue has been selected.
        Specified by:
        selectVenue in interface VenueLayerAdapter
        Parameters:
        venue - An object representing the venue to be selected.
        Returns:
        true, if the venue has been found on the map and opened, otherwise false.

      • selectVenueAsync

        public VenueInfo selectVenueAsync(java.lang.String id)
        Description copied from interface: VenueLayerAdapter
        This method uses the id provided by the caller to select the corresponding venue in a 3D view mode. In the 3D view mode, layers and spaces of the venue are visible for the application user. The method is asynchronous, because the venue must be downloaded if it is not already present in the cache. The callback method VenueMapFragment.VenueListener.onVenueSelected(Venue) is called when the venue have been selected.
        Specified by:
        selectVenueAsync in interface VenueLayerAdapter
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier of the venue to be selected.
        Returns:
        An object representing the venue info on success, null if no venue was found to match the supplied identifier.
        See Also:
        Venue.getId()

      • selectAsync

        public VenueInfo selectAsync(java.lang.String venueId,
                             java.lang.String spaceId)
        Description copied from interface: VenueLayerAdapter
        This method selects a Venue and a Space within it in a 3D view mode. The venue and space must match their respective ids as provided by the caller. In the 3D view mode layers and spaces of the venue are visible for the application user. The method is asynchronous, because the venue must be downloaded if it is not already present in the cache. VenueMapFragment.VenueListener.onVenueSelected(Venue) callback method is called when the venue have been selected.
        Specified by:
        selectAsync in interface VenueLayerAdapter
        Parameters:
        venueId - The id of the venue to be selected.
        spaceId - The id of the space to be selected. If null, only the venue is selected.
        Returns:
        An object representing the venue info on success, null if no venue was found to match the supplied identifier.
        See Also:
        Venue.getId(), SpatialObject.getId()

      • setVenueUpdatesEnabled

        public void setVenueUpdatesEnabled(boolean value)
        Description copied from interface: VenueLayerAdapter
        Controls whether updates are enabled for the venues on the map. If this property is set to false and there are upcoming updates for the venues on the map (i.e. you can get a valid VenueController instance of that Venue via VenueLayerAdapter.getVenueController(Venue), then these updates will be discarded until next app-n start.
        Specified by:
        setVenueUpdatesEnabled in interface VenueLayerAdapter
        Parameters:
        value - true if the venue updates for the VenueLayerAdapter should be enabled and false otherwise.

      • setMargin

        public void setMargin(Margin value)
        Description copied from interface: VenueLayerAdapter
        This method sets the margins for the current venue view in screen pixels. The defaults are (0, 0, 0, 0).
        Specified by:
        setMargin in interface VenueLayerAdapter
        Parameters:
        value - please see Margin for more details.

        value#left A value indicating the left margin, should be less than one-third of screen width.

        value#top A value indicating the top margin, should be less than one-third of screen height.

        value#right A value indicating the right margin, should be less than one-third of screen width.

        value#bottom A value indicating the bottom margin, should be less than one-third of screen height.

        See Also:
        VenueLayerAdapter.getMargin()
